text: Big appreciation to whoever made struct unpacking from binary files a 3-4 liner. Talk about convenient. Also a good reminder how custom I/O is super easy in Julia. :)

elements.text: Big appreciation to whoever made struct unpacking from binary files a 3-4 liner. Talk about convenient. Also a good reminder how custom I/O is super easy in Julia. :)

text: any example of how to do that?

elements.text: any example of how to do that?

text: let me make one, its on my work computer :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: let me make one, its on my work computer

text:
```struct happyholidays
    cookies::UInt32
    pasta::Float64
end

s_out = open("cookies4christmass.bina", "w") do f
    write(f, Ref(happyholidays(UInt32(42),1.11)))
end

s_in = open("cookies4christmass.bina") do f
    read!(f, Ref{happyholidays}())
end

println("how many cookies: ",s_in[].cookies)
println("how much pastas though?",s_in[].pasta)```
enjoy

elements.text:
struct happyholidays
    cookies::UInt32
    pasta::Float64
end

s_out = open("cookies4christmass.bina", "w") do f
    write(f, Ref(happyholidays(UInt32(42),1.11)))
end

s_in = open("cookies4christmass.bina") do f
    read!(f, Ref{happyholidays}())
end

println("how many cookies: ",s_in[].cookies)
println("how much pastas though?",s_in[].pasta)
